Account.Name: Sales
Account.Description: Income from any normal business activity

Account.Name: Other Revenue
Account.Description: Any other income that does not relate to normal business activities and is not recurring

Account.Name: Interest Income
Account.Description: Gross interest income (i.e. before deducting Residential Withholding Tax), such as bank interest

Account.Name: Purchases
Account.Description: Goods purchased with the intention of selling these to customers

Account.Name: Advertising
Account.Description: Expenses incurred for advertising while trying to increase sales

Account.Name: Bank Fees
Account.Description: Fees charged by your bank for transactions regarding your bank account(s)

Account.Name: Cleaning
Account.Description: Expenses incurred for cleaning business property.

Account.Name: Consulting & Accounting
Account.Description: Expenses related to paying consultants

Account.Name: Depreciation
Account.Description: The amount of the asset's cost (based on the useful life) that was consumed during the period

Account.Name: Entertainment
Account.Description: 50% of the total expense relating to business-related entertainment. E.g. shouting clients or employees a drink or a meal etc.

Account.Name: Entertainment - Non deductible
Account.Description: Expenses paid by company for the business but are not deductable for income tax purposes.

Account.Name: Freight & Courier
Account.Description: Expenses incurred on courier & freight costs

Account.Name: General Expenses
Account.Description: General expenses related to the running of the business.

Account.Name: Insurance
Account.Description: Expenses incurred for insuring the business' assets

Account.Name: Interest Expense
Account.Description: Any interest expenses paid to IRD, business bank accounts or credit card accounts.

Account.Name: Legal expenses
Account.Description: Expenses incurred on any legal matters

Account.Name: Light, Power, Heating
Account.Description: Expenses incurred for lighting, powering or heating the premises

Account.Name: Motor Vehicle Expenses
Account.Description: Expenses incurred on the running of company motor vehicles

Account.Name: Office Expenses
Account.Description: General expenses related to the running of the business office.

Account.Name: Printing & Stationery
Account.Description: Expenses incurred by the entity as a result of printing and stationery

Account.Name: Rent
Account.Description: The payment to lease a building or area.

Account.Name: Repairs and Maintenance
Account.Description: Expenses incurred on a damaged or run down asset that will bring the asset back to its original condition.

Account.Name: Salaries
Account.Description: Payment to employees in exchange for their resources

Account.Name: Commission
Account.Description: For commission costs associated with sales.

Account.Name: Subscriptions
Account.Description: E.g. Magazines, professional bodies.

Account.Name: Telephone & Internet
Account.Description: Expenditure incurred from any business-related phone calls, phone lines, or internet connections

Account.Name: Travel - Local
Account.Description: For all local taxi and shuttle travel; carparking building when on customer site etc

Account.Name: Travel - National
Account.Description: Expenses incurred from domestic travel which has a business purpose

Account.Name: Travel - International
Account.Description: Expenses incurred from international travel which has a business purpose

Account.Name: Bank Revaluations
Account.Description: Bank account revaluations due for foreign exchange rate changes

Account.Name: Unrealised Currency Gains
Account.Description: Unrealised currency gains on outstanding items

Account.Name: Realised Currency Gains
Account.Description: Gains or losses made due to currency exchange rate changes

Account.Name: Income Tax Expense
Account.Description: A percentage of total earnings paid to the government.

Account.Name: Accounts Receivable
Account.Description: Outstanding invoices the company has issued out to the client but has not yet received in cash at balance date.

Account.Name: less Provision for Doubtful Debts
Account.Description: A provision anticipating that some of the accounts receivables will become bad debts.

Account.Name: Prepayments
Account.Description: An expenditure that has been paid for in advance.

Account.Name: Withholding tax paid
Account.Description: Withholding tax paid

Account.Name: Office Equipment
Account.Description: Office equipment that is owned and controlled by the business

Account.Name: Less Accumulated Depreciation on Office Equipment
Account.Description: The total amount of office equipment cost that has been consumed by the entity (based on the useful life)

Account.Name: Computer Equipment
Account.Description: Computer equipment that is owned and controlled by the business

Account.Name: Less Accumulated Depreciation on Computer Equipment
Account.Description: The total amount of computer equipment cost that has been consumed by the business (based on the useful life)

Account.Name: Accounts Payable
Account.Description: Outstanding invoices the company has received from suppliers but has not yet paid at balance date

Account.Name: Unpaid Expense Claims
Account.Description: Expense claims typically made by employees/shareholder employees still outstanding.

Account.Name: GST
Account.Description: The balance in this account represents GST owing to or from the IRD. At the end of the GST period, it is this account that should be used to code against either the 'refunds from' or 'payments to' the IRD that will appear on the bank statement. Xero has been designed to use only one GST account to track GST on income and expenses, so there is no need to add any new GST accounts to Xero.

Account.Name: PAYE Payable
Account.Description: The amount of PAYE tax that is due to be paid

Account.Name: Income Tax
Account.Description: The amount of income tax that is due to be paid, also resident withholding tax paid on interest received.

Account.Name: Historical Adjustment
Account.Description: For accountant adjustments

Account.Name: Suspense
Account.Description: An entry that allows an unknown transaction to be entered, so the accounts can still be worked on in balance and the entry can be dealt with later.

Account.Name: Rounding
Account.Description: An adjustment entry to allow for rounding

Account.Name: Tracking Transfers
Account.Description: Transfers between tracking categories

Account.Name: Loan
Account.Description: Money that has been borrowed from a creditor

Account.Name: Retained Earnings
Account.Description: Do not Use

Account.Name: Owner A Funds Introduced
Account.Description: Funds contributed by the owner

Account.Name: Owner A Drawings
Account.Description: Withdrawals by the owners
